column4: I have a pro/wireless 3945ABG that up until today was working, but now it doesn't detect it, would anybody know what to do about this?
and when I run iwconfig it says that lo and eth0 have no extensions

i have same wireless, and something happened with latest update that messed mine up. it added auto eth1 to my interfaces file, so i couldn't connect (i use wpa). commented it out, when i booted today had to run sudo ifup eth1. don't know why yet...
then I should run sudo ifup eth1 and reboot?  / Do you think this change will be permanent?
don't know if it will be permanent, haven't rebooted since :). If you run the ifup, you should see it trying to get an ip address, if finishes successfully, you should be on line
sorry for all the questions, what is the interfaces file you edited?
/etc/network/interfaces. it had added an auto eth1 at the end, that is what i commented out...my normal eth1 stanza was untouched.
that should be ok...but not that there isn't anything else
lol that's what I thought, is there anywhere where they have what is suppose to be in that file?
typically, you have a stanza for each interface...on mine lo, eth0 (wired) and eth1 (wireless)
ok, I'll work on it, thanks for the help, you rock!
if you're not doing anything special, like wep or wpa, just adding auto eth0 or 1 should help
should I just copy what's there for lo with eth0 or eth1?
its worth a try. after you do that, then run sudo ifdown and sudo ifup

I tried adding auto eth0 iface eth0 inet loopback into interfaces and then ifdown -a ifup -a and everything came out without error, but I do not have wireless still, what do you think I should do here?
not quite right. you want auto eth0 carriage return iface eth0 inet dhcp
